intro: Anomospermum nitidum, commonly known as the smooth-barked tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Olacaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, alternate leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is often found in dry, open woodlands and is adapted to arid environments.
